abstract.p: Eddie Sugarman letter about April 22 article about Barbara Stanwyck says moral ambiguity of her characters makes it worth spending time to get to know them (S)

block.p: In ''The Infinite Variety of the Lady Stanwyck'' [April 22], Terrence Rafferty writes that Barbara Stanwyck excelled at playing ''a woman men just can't seem to get a fix on.'' Andrew Gerle and I spent the last five years trying to get a fix on Ann Mitchell, her reporter in ''Meet John Doe.'' Ann ruins lives, but Stanwyck somehow keeps you on her side. In adapting the film for a stage musical, we agonized over Ann's likability until we realized it's the moral ambiguity that makes Stanwyck's characters worth spending several hours, or five years, getting to know.
The writer is the lyricist and a book writer of ''Meet John Doe.''
